title: 112_hr6329
content: The "Build It in America Act of 2012" establishes a permanent credit for research activities, increases the credit for businesses manufacturing in the United States, and makes the credit refundable for small businesses. The "Build It in America Act of 2012" establishes a permanent research credit and enhances the credit for domestic manufacturers. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code remove certain subsections and apply to expenses after December 31, 2011. The "Build It in America Act of 2012" enhances the credit for domestic manufacturers by increasing the 20 percent amount for qualified domestic manufacturers with a domestic production percentage of more than 50 percent. The "Build It in America Act of 2012" increases the credit for domestic manufacturers by adjusting the bonus amount based on activities regardless of location. The "Build It in America Act of 2012" adjusts the bonus amount for domestic manufacturers based on production percentage, increasing by 2, 4, 6, 8, or 10 percentage points depending on the level of domestic production. The amendment made by this section applies to expenditures after December 31, 2011. Section 41 of the Code is amended to make the credit refundable for small businesses meeting specific criteria. The amendment allows businesses with less than 800 employees to be treated as small businesses for tax credit purposes, with a modified applicable percentage. The amendment sets applicable percentages based on the number of employees, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2011.
